Weight for Age-Boys: Plot current weight on Growth chart
Look for oedema of both feet
For Children aged 6 months or above:

Determine the MUAC [mid upper arm circumference] and if its below 11.5cm OR Oedema is present, assess appetite. Appetite is assessed by observing the child eating RUTF [Ready-To-Use Therapeutic Food.]
NB: If tapes are not available for MUAC, look for visible severe wasting:
Remove the child’s clothes and look;
For severe wasting of the muscles of the shoulders, arms, buttocks and legs
For severe wasting of the muscles of the shoulders, arms, buttocks and legs
At the child’s hips which may look small compared to the chest and abdomen
At the child from the side to see if the fat of the buttocks is missing.
